name: Pork Bourguignon
ingredients: pork shoulder, bacon, onions, carrots, mushrooms, garlic, red wine, pork broth, thyme, bay leaf, butter, flour, salt, pepper, parsley
quantities: 2 lbs pork shoulder, 6 oz bacon, 1 large onion, 3 carrots, 10 oz mushrooms, 3 cloves garlic, 2 cups red wine, 2 cups pork broth, 1 bay leaf, 2-3 sprigs thyme, 2 tbsp butter, 2 tbsp flour, salt and pepper to taste, fresh parsley for garnish
recipe:
1. Season 2 lbs pork shoulder with salt and pepper. Cook 6 oz bacon until crispy, remove and set aside.
2. Brown pork in bacon fat. Remove and set aside.
3. Sauté 1 large chopped onion and 3 chopped carrots until soft. Add 3 minced garlic cloves and cook for 1-2 minutes.
4. Add 2 tbsp tomato paste and cook for 1-2 minutes. Pour in 2 cups red wine and deglaze the pot.
5. Add 2 cups pork broth, 1 bay leaf, 2-3 sprigs thyme, 10 oz quartered mushrooms, pork, and bacon. Simmer until pork is tender, about 1.5 to 2 hours.
6. Make a beurre manié with 2 tbsp butter and 2 tbsp flour, and stir into the stew to thicken.
7. Season with salt and pepper, garnish with fresh parsley, and serve.
